title: FPS dropped from 200+ to 60 after Windows update
body:
Hi,

My issue is that after a recent Windows 10 update, my FPS in game dropped from over 200+ to 60. I know 60 FPS is already great and I can play the game well, but I am used to 200+ FPS and would like to get it back. 

My device specs are:
ASUS ROG GL552VW-DH71 15-Inch Gaming Laptop, Discrete GPU GeForce GTX 960M 2GB VRAM, 16GB DDR4, 1TB (ROG Metallic)
i7 6700 processor
960m Nvidia GPU w/ 2GB memory
16 GB RAM
1TB HDD

I have already browsed some forums and turned off VSync in both the LoL client as well as the nvidia control panel. I have already set the framerate cap to unlimited, and have also tried FPS caps of over 60 to see if it would at least get me to 120 fps. None of these settings have made any difference, and I am still stuck as 60fps. 

I have already updated the GPU driver to version GeForce Game Ready Driver v372.54. I have also made sure that i ran the league client by right clicking the launcher and selecting "Run with graphics processor nvidia..." to make sure its running with the GPU rather than integrated graphics.

Would anyone have an idea of what else I can do to get my framerate back?

replies.body:
It sounds like you installed the Anniversary update, which enabled the Xbox Game DVR feature. I recommend [disabling this feature entirely](http://www.tenforums.com/tutorials/8637-game-bar-turn-off-windows-10-a.html) to see if it resolves the problem.

Let me know if it did! :)

> [{quoted}](name=Targons Blade,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=HWTiT57O,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2016-08-22T17:52:35.692+0000)
>
> It sounds like you installed the Anniversary update, which enabled the Xbox Game DVR feature. I recommend [disabling this feature entirely](http://www.tenforums.com/tutorials/8637-game-bar-turn-off-windows-10-a.html) to see if it resolves the problem.
> 
> Let me know if it did! :)

i have the same problem with a similar type of laptop. currently repairing the client and i already disabled the xbox thingy. ill let you know if it works after.

edit: it worked and my fps is back to normal godbless the usa
god bless this post, XD i was searching out how to fix and glad someone made a post
IT WORKED ty so much for the info I was getting a bit tilted cause of this, you made my day ty! {{champion:99}}

I turned off Game DVR, and the FPS actually drops to 30 now.

Edit: Yes, I am now locked at 30 FPS. It jumps up temporarily to 60 when I tab out, but when I tab back it, it gradually degrades to 30 over a few seconds.

Well, that's certainly an unexpected result! Since your FPS wasn't improved, there may be a driver or windows power setting causing the issue. Our [FPS troubleshooting guide](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752684-Low-Frame-Rate-FPS-Troubleshooting) is a great next step in finding a solution for this.

Let me know the results.
